ground_truth: Angela pulls her uniform open, and a profusion of red rose petals spill forth. Fully clothed, she is once again surrounded by the other girls as the high school band plays its last note, the Dancing Spartanettes strike their final pose, and the audience reacts. Carolyn claps along with the rest of the audience, while Lester just sits there, unable to take his eyes off Angela. The game is long over when Jane and Angela come out of the gym, and Lester and Carolyn stand at the edge of the parking lot. Jane crosses reluctantly toward her parents, followed by Angela, creating an awkward beat. As Jane starts toward the parking lot, Lester stays behind. Angela smiles, aware of the power she has over Lester, who is mesmerized and feels grateful. Close on a solitary red rose petal as it falls slowly through the air. We're looking down on Lester and Carolyn in bed, and even in sleep, Carolyn looks determined while Lester is awake and stares up at us. The rose petal drifts into view, landing on his pillow, and more rose petals fall onto the bed as he smiles up at them. Angela, naked, floats above us as a deluge of rose petals falls around her, her hair fanning out around her head and glowing with a subtle, burnished light. She looks down at us with a smile that is all things. Lester smiles back and laughs as rose petals cover his face. Jane stares at the floor and later gets out of the car, still laughing, and waves as Angela pulls away. We zoom toward Jane as she walks up the driveway. Suddenly, she turns, sensing our presence, and we see the colonial house next door where the moving van was parked earlier, with the front porch shrouded in darkness until a porch light abruptly reveals Ricky. As usual, Ricky is dressed conservatively. Irritated, Jane stares at him hard, and he looks back at her curiously, then raises his digicam and starts to videotape her. His point of view, on video, shows Jane, angry and self-conscious, turning and walking quickly toward her house, flipping us off as she goes. Jane enters, closes and locks the door, quickly turns off the light that's been left on for her, then peeks through a window and smiles. Jane turns back into the room, her heart racing. Lester, dressed for work, goes through Jane's address book and grabs Jane's phone to dial, standing with the receiver to his ear, nervous but frozen and unable to speak. He hangs up and exits quickly as Jane emerges from the bathroom, a towel wrapped around her torso, drying her wet hair. She picks up the phone. Meanwhile, Angela is sprawled across her bed, on the phone. Jane then notices her address book open to the H page.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Angela pulls her garb open, and an abundance of crimson rose petals spill forth. Fully dressed, she is once again surrounded by the other girls as the high school ensemble plays its last note, the Dancing Spartanettes strike their final pose, and the spectators react. Carolyn applauds along with the rest of the audience, while Lester just sits there, unable to take his eyes off Angela. The game is long over when Jane and Angela emerge from the gym, and Lester and Carolyn stand at the edge of the parking area. Jane crosses reluctantly toward her guardians, followed by Angela, creating an awkward moment. As Jane starts toward the parking lot, Lester stays behind. Angela smiles, aware of the influence she has over Lester, who is spellbound and feels grateful. Close on a solitary red rose petal as it descends slowly through the air. We're looking down on Lester and Carolyn in bed, and even in sleep, Carolyn looks resolute while Lester is awake and stares up at us. The rose petal floats into view, landing on his pillow, and more rose petals drift onto the bed as he smiles up at them. Angela, bare, hovers above us as a flood of rose petals falls around her, her hair fanning out around her head and glowing with a subtle, burnished radiance. She looks down at us with a smile that is all things. Lester smiles back and laughs as rose petals cover his face. Jane gazes at the floor and later gets out of the car, still laughing, and waves as Angela pulls away. We zoom toward Jane as she walks up the driveway. Suddenly, she turns, sensing our presence, and we see the colonial residence next door where the moving van was parked earlier, with the front porch veiled in darkness until a porch light suddenly reveals Ricky. As usual, Ricky is attired conservatively. Aggravated, Jane stares at him hard, and he looks back at her inquisitively, then raises his camcorder and starts to record her. His perspective, on video, shows Jane, irate and self-conscious, turning and walking quickly toward her house, flipping us off as she goes. Jane enters, closes and locks the door, quickly turns off the light that's been left on for her, then peeks through a window and smiles. Jane turns back into the room, her heart racing. Lester, dressed for work, goes through Jane's contact book and grabs Jane's phone to dial, standing with the receiver to his ear, anxious but frozen and unable to speak. He hangs up and exits quickly as Jane emerges from the bathroom, a towel wrapped around her torso, drying her damp hair. She picks up the phone. Meanwhile, Angela is sprawled across her bed, on the telephone. Jane then notices her contact book open to the H page.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Angela's uniform is pulled open by her, and a profusion of red rose petals is spilled forth. Fully clothed, she once again finds herself surrounded by the other girls as the high school band plays its last note, the final pose is struck by the Dancing Spartanettes, and the audience reacts. Carolyn claps along with the rest of the audience, while Lester just sits there, unable to take his eyes off Angela. The gym is exited by Jane and Angela long after the game is over, and at the edge of the parking lot stand Lester and Carolyn. Jane reluctantly crosses toward her parents, followed by Angela, creating an awkward beat. As the parking lot is approached by Jane, Lester stays behind. Angela smiles, aware of the power she wields over Lester, who is mesmerized and feels grateful. A solitary red rose petal falls slowly through the air. Lester and Carolyn are looked down upon by us as they lie in bed, and even in sleep, Carolyn appears determined while Lester is awake and stares up at us. The view is entered by a drifting rose petal, landing on his pillow, and more rose petals fall onto the bed as smiles are given up at them by him. Angela, naked, floats above us as a deluge of rose petals surrounds her, her hair fanning out around her head and glowing with a subtle, burnished light. She looks down at us with a smile that encompasses all things. Lester smiles back and laughs as his face is covered by rose petals. Jane stares at the floor and later gets out of the car, still laughing, and waves as Angela pulls away. Zooming toward Jane, we watch her walk up the driveway. Suddenly, she turns, sensing our presence, and sees the colonial house next door where a moving van was parked earlier, with the front porch shrouded in darkness until a porch light abruptly reveals Ricky. As usual, Ricky dresses conservatively. Irritably, Jane stares at him hard, and her curious look is met by him, then he raises his digicam and videotapes her. His point of view, on video, shows Jane, angry and self-conscious, turn and walk quickly toward her house, flipping us off as she goes. Jane enters, closes and locks the door, quickly turns off the light that had been left on for her, then peeks through a window and smiles. Her heart racing, Jane turns back into the room. Dressed for work, Lester goes through Jane's address book and grabs Jane's phone to dial, standing with the receiver to his ear, nervous but frozen and unable to speak. He hangs up and exits quickly as Jane emerges from the bathroom, a towel wrapped around her torso, drying her wet hair. She picks up the phone. Meanwhile, Angela sprawls across her bed, on the phone. Jane then notices her address book opened to the H page.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Angela opens her uniform, releasing a cascade of red rose petals. Surrounded by the other girls, fully clothed, she hears the high school band conclude their performance as the Dancing Spartanettes strike their final pose. The audience, including clapping Carolyn, reacts while Lester fixates on Angela. Post-game, Jane and Angela exit the gym to find Lester and Carolyn waiting. Jane reluctantly approaches her parents, with Angela creating an awkward pause. Lester lingers, mesmerized by Angela's power. A red rose petal falls, drifting onto Lester's pillow as he lies awake. More petals land on the bed, and Angela, glowing and smiling, floats above him. Lester laughs as petals cover his face. Jane, exiting the car, waves at Angela. While walking home, she senses the colonial house's darkness before a porch light reveals Ricky. Dressed conservatively, Ricky records Jane, who reacts angrily and flips him off. Inside, Jane locks the door, smiles, and her heart races. Lester, ready for work, nervously dials a number from Jane's address book but hangs up silently as Jane exits the bathroom. Angela talks on the phone while Jane notices her address book open to the H page.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Angela opens her uniform, spilling red rose petals. Fully clothed, she's surrounded by girls as the band plays its last note. Carolyn claps; Lester watches Angela, entranced. After the game, Jane hesitantly approaches her parents, followed by Angela. Lester, captivated, stays behind as Angela smiles, knowing her effect. A red petal falls upon Lester and Carolyn in bed; petals shower down as he smiles. Angela floats above, surrounded by petals, smiling at Lester. Jane laughs, exits a car, waves to Angela, then walks home. She notices Ricky next door, annoyed, as he films her with a digicam. Jane flips him off, enters her house, locks the door, turns out a light, and peeks through the window, smiling. Her heart races as Lester, preparing for work, tries to make a call but hesitates. Jane, emerging from the bathroom, notices her address book open to the H page as Angela, on her bed, talks on the phone.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Angela gently pulls her uniform open, and an overwhelming profusion of red rose petals spills forth in a captivating cascade. Though she remains fully clothed, she finds herself once again enveloped by the other girls as the high school band triumphantly plays its last resonating note. The Dancing Spartanettes hold their final poised position, and the audience erupts with a variety of reactions. Among the crowd, Carolyn joins in clapping along with the rest, while Lester simply sits there, transfixed, unable to divert his gaze from Angela. By the time the game has long concluded, Jane and Angela emerge from the gymnasium, and Lester and Carolyn stand patiently at the edge of the bustling parking lot. Jane crosses reluctantly toward where her parents await, closely followed by Angela, creating an awkward and tense moment. As Jane begins her journey toward the parking lot, Lester remains behind. Angela, fully aware of the power she effortlessly wields over Lester, smiles knowingly; Lester is utterly captivated and feels an overwhelming sense of gratitude. The camera focuses on a solitary red rose petal, floating slowly and gracefully through the air. We then look down on Lester and Carolyn resting in bed; even while sleeping, Carolyn possesses a determined expression, contrasting with Lester, who is very much awake and staring intently upward at us. The delicate rose petal gently drifts into view, landing softly on his pillow, while more rose petals cascade onto the bed, prompting him to smile up at them with delight. Angela, bare and unencumbered, floats serenely above us as a torrent of rose petals cascades all around her, her hair gracefully fanning out around her head, glowing with a subtle, burnished light. She looks down at us with an enigmatic smile that seems to encompass all things. Lester, in response, smiles back and laughs joyously as rose petals blissfully cover his face. Meanwhile, Jane, staring at the floor, later exits the car. Still laughing, she waves farewell as Angela drives away. The camera zooms in intriguingly on Jane as she makes her way up the driveway. Abruptly, she turns, sensing our presence, and we catch a glimpse of the colonial house next door, where a moving van had been parked earlier. The front porch lies shrouded in darkness until a porch light suddenly flickers on, revealing Ricky. As always, Ricky is dressed in conservative attire. Jane glares at him irritably, while he returns her gaze curiously. Then, with a calm resolve, he raises his digital camcorder and begins to videotape her. His point of view, captured on video, displays Jane looking angry and self-conscious as she turns and quickly walks toward her house, flipping us off defiantly as she goes. Once inside, Jane closes and locks the door swiftly, turns off the light that had been left on for her, then peeks through a window, smiling to herself. She turns back into the room, her heart racing with anticipation. Lester, already dressed for work, searches through Jane's address book, seizes Jane's phone, and begins to dial, standing there with the receiver pressed against his ear, consumed by nervousness yet paralyzed and unable to utter a word. Finally, he hangs up and exits hastily as Jane emerges from the bathroom, a towel wrapped securely around her torso while she dries her wet hair. She picks up the phone. At the same time, Angela is sprawled leisurely across her own bed, engaged in a phone conversation. Jane then notices her address book, left open to the H page.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Angela, with a gentle gesture, opens her uniform, and an overwhelming profusion of deep red rose petals spills forth, cascading captivatingly in all directions. Although she remains fully clothed, she finds herself, once again, enveloped in the warm embrace of the other girls just as the high school band triumphantly plays its last, resonating note. The Dancing Spartanettes hold their final poised position, and the audience erupts with a variety of enthusiastic reactions. Among the crowd, Carolyn joins in clapping along with everyone else, while Lester simply sits there, completely transfixed, unable to divert his gaze from Angela. By the time the game has long concluded, Jane and Angela, together, emerge from the gymnasium, and Lester and Carolyn stand patiently at the edge of the bustling parking lot. Jane crosses reluctantly toward where her parents stand waiting, closely followed by Angela, creating a moment filled with awkwardness and tension. As Jane begins her journey toward the parking lot, Lester remains behind. Angela, fully aware of the power she effortlessly wields over Lester, smiles knowingly; Lester is utterly captivated and feels an overwhelming sense of gratitude. The camera then focuses on a solitary red rose petal, floating slowly and gracefully through the air. We then look down on Lester and Carolyn resting in bed; even while sleeping, Carolyn possesses a determined expression on her face, contrasting with Lester, who is very much awake and staring intently upward at us. The delicate rose petal gently drifts into view, landing softly on his pillow, while more rose petals cascade onto the bed, prompting him to smile up at them with delight. Angela, bare and unencumbered, floats serenely above us, as a torrent of rose petals cascades all around her, her hair gracefully fanning out around her head, glowing with a subtle, burnished light. She looks down at us with an enigmatic smile that seems to encompass all things. Lester, in response, smiles back and laughs joyously as rose petals blissfully cover his face. Meanwhile, Jane, staring at the floor, later exits the car. Still laughing, she waves farewell as Angela drives away. The camera zooms in intriguingly on Jane as she makes her way up the driveway. Abruptly, she turns, sensing our presence, and we catch a glimpse of the colonial house next door, where a moving van had been parked earlier in the day. The front porch lies shrouded in darkness until a porch light suddenly flickers on, revealing Ricky. As always, Ricky is dressed in conservative attire. Jane glares at him irritably, while he returns her gaze curiously. Then, with a calm resolve, he raises his digital camcorder and begins to videotape her. His point of view, captured on the video, displays Jane looking angry and self-conscious as she turns and quickly walks toward her house, flipping us off defiantly as she goes. Once inside, Jane closes and locks the door swiftly, turns off the light that had been left on for her, then peeks through a window, smiling to herself in a satisfied manner. She turns back into the room, her heart racing with anticipation. Lester, already dressed for work, searches through Jane's address book, seizes Jane's phone, and begins to dial, standing there with the receiver pressed against his ear, consumed by nervousness yet paralyzed and unable to utter a word. Finally, he hangs up and exits hastily as Jane emerges from the bathroom, a towel wrapped securely around her torso while she dries her wet hair. She picks up the phone. At the same time, Angela is sprawled leisurely across her own bed, engaged in a phone conversation. Jane then notices her address book, left open to the H page.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Angela begins by theatrically pulling open her uniform, creating a dramatic moment as an abundance of red rose petals cascade out and scatter around her. While remaining fully clothed, Angela finds herself once more encircled by her fellow girls, just as the high school band reaches the crescendo of its performance with a resonant final note. The Dancing Spartanettes simultaneously execute their last elegant pose, which prompts a wave of reactions from the audience. Amidst this, Carolyn energetically joins the rest of the audience in clapping, her hands meeting enthusiastically in applause, while Lester remains motionless in his seat, utterly captivated by Angela and incapable of diverting his gaze from her. As time passes and the game concludes, Jane and Angela emerge from the gymnasium, with Lester and Carolyn positioned at the outskirts of the parking lot, waiting expectantly. Jane hesitantly steps toward her parents, with Angela trailing slightly behind, causing a palpable moment of awkwardness. As Jane strides toward the parking area, Lester lingers, his eyes fixed on Angela, who, with a knowing smile, acknowledges the influence she holds over him and the gratitude he feels in that mesmerized state. A solitary red rose petal drifts languidly through the air, capturing attention as it gently lands. We then observe Lester and Carolyn lying in their bed from above; even in her sleep, Carolyn’s features reflect determination, while Lester remains awake, eyes cast upward. As the tender red rose petal descends into his view, resting softly on his pillow, a cascade of additional rose petals showers onto the bed, prompting Lester to gaze up at them with a smile. In this ethereal scene, Angela appears unclothed and suspended, enveloped by a torrent of rose petals that fall gracefully, while her hair radiates outward like a halo, shimmering with a warm, subtle light. She gazes downward with a smile that embodies myriad emotions, a smile that Lester returns with laughter as the rose petals envelop his face. Driving away later, Jane casts her eyes downward and, still chuckling, exits the car before giving a parting wave as Angela departs. The camera zooms in on Jane, capturing her as she walks up the driveway. Abruptly, she halts, sensing an unseen observer’s presence, and her gaze shifts to the colonial house next door, where a moving van was previously stationed. The front porch remains cloaked in shadows until a sudden illumination from the porch light reveals Ricky, clothed conservatively as expected. Jane, with irritation, fixes Ricky with a hard stare, to which he responds with a curious expression and then raises his digicam, commencing to record her. Through his lens, Jane appears visibly angered and self-conscious as she turns away, hastily moving toward her home and flipping him off before disappearing inside. Once inside, Jane promptly closes and locks the door, her hand flicking off the light left on for her before she peers through the window, her lips curling into a smile. Turning back into the room, she feels the rapid beating of her heart. Meanwhile, Lester, attired for work, rifles through Jane's address book, retrieves Jane's phone, and with the receiver pressed to his ear, stands immobilized by nerves, unable to articulate any words. He reluctantly replaces the receiver and swiftly exits the room just as Jane emerges from the bathroom, a towel wrapped snugly around her torso as she attends to drying her damp hair. As she notices the unattended phone, Angela reclines across her bed, engaged in a phone conversation. Jane, her attention drawn, notices her address book open to the H page, sparking curiosity and surprise.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Angela dramatically reveals a cascade of red rose petals, signaling the end of the high school performance as the audience, including Carolyn and Lester, reacts. After the game, Jane and Angela join Lester and Carolyn, creating a brief awkward moment before Jane heads home. Angela, aware of Lester's entranced admiration, departs with a knowing smile. In a dreamlike sequence, Lester lies in bed, enchanted as rose petals fall around him, and imagines Angela floating above, her presence illuminating the scene. Meanwhile, Jane exits a car, laughing, and notices Angela driving away. As she approaches her house, she spots Ricky next door, who starts filming her. Annoyed, Jane hurriedly retreats inside, flipping off the camera, then peeks out to smile knowingly. Inside, Lester, dressed for work, hesitantly attempts to make a call using Jane's phone but loses nerve and leaves as Jane, fresh from a shower, notices her open address book. Across town, Angela is relaxed on her bed, engaged in a phone conversation.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Angela pulls her uniform open, revealing an unexpected profusion of red rose petals, a classic symbol of love and beauty, spilling forth. Fully clothed, she is once again surrounded by the other girls as the high school band, renowned for its energetic performances during football games, plays its last note. The Dancing Spartanettes, a team famous for their precision and grace, strike their final pose, and the audience reacts with enthusiasm. Carolyn claps along with the rest of the audience, while Lester just sits there, unable to take his eyes off Angela, captivated by her presence. The game is long over when Jane and Angela come out of the gym, and Lester and Carolyn stand at the edge of the parking lot, where the crowd is slowly dispersing. Jane crosses reluctantly toward her parents, followed by Angela, creating an awkward beat. As Jane starts toward the parking lot, Lester stays behind, drawn to Angela's allure. Angela smiles, aware of the power she has over Lester, who is mesmerized and feels grateful for her attention. Close on a solitary red rose petal, a symbol of the fleeting nature of beauty, as it falls slowly through the air. We're looking down on Lester and Carolyn in bed, and even in sleep, Carolyn looks determined, her mind perhaps occupied with the day's events, while Lester is awake and stares up at us, lost in thought. The rose petal drifts into view, landing on his pillow, and more rose petals fall onto the bed as he smiles up at them, a gentle reminder of Angela's hypnotic presence. Angela, naked and serene, floats above us as a deluge of rose petals falls around her, her hair fanning out around her head and glowing with a subtle, burnished light reminiscent of a pre-Raphaelite painting. She looks down at us with a smile that embodies a myriad of emotions. Lester smiles back and laughs as rose petals cover his face, an expression of his liberation from everyday worries. Jane stares at the floor and later gets out of the car, still laughing, and waves as Angela pulls away, her laughter a release of tension. We zoom toward Jane as she walks up the driveway of her suburban home. Suddenly, she turns, sensing our presence, and we see the colonial house next door where the moving van was parked earlier, an indication of new beginnings, with the front porch shrouded in darkness until a porch light abruptly reveals Ricky. As usual, Ricky is dressed conservatively, consistent with his reserved nature. Irritated, Jane stares at him hard, and he looks back at her curiously, then raises his digicam, a recent birthday gift from his parents, and starts to videotape her. His point of view, on video, shows Jane, angry and self-conscious, turning and walking quickly toward her house, flipping us off as she goes, an expression of her frustration. Jane enters, closes and locks the door, quickly turns off the light that's been left on for her, then peeks through a window and smiles, comforted by the security of her home. Jane turns back into the room, her heart racing with a mix of emotions. Lester, dressed for work at the local office where he has recently been promoted, goes through Jane's address book and grabs Jane's phone to dial, standing with the receiver to his ear, nervous but frozen and unable to speak, caught in indecision. He hangs up and exits quickly as Jane emerges from the bathroom, a towel wrapped around her torso, drying her wet hair, freshly showered. She picks up the phone, noticing the number Lester had tried to dial. Meanwhile, Angela is sprawled across her bed, on the phone, chatting animatedly. Jane then notices her address book open to the H page, puzzled by the coincidence.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Angela pulls her uniform open and a profusion of red rose petals spill forth. Fully clothed she is once again surrounded by the other girls. as the high school band plays its last note. the Dancing Spartanettes strike their final pose and the audience reacts. Carolyn claps along with the rest of the audience while Lester just sits there unable to take his eyes off Angela. The game is long over when Jane and Angela come out of the gym and Lester and Carolyn stand at the edge of the parking lot. Jane crosses reluctantly toward her parents followed by Angela creating an awkward beat. As Jane starts toward the parking lot Lester stays behind. Angela smiles aware of the power she has over Lester who is mesmerized and feels grateful. Close on a solitary red rose petal as it falls slowly through the air. We are looking down on Lester and Carolyn in bed and even in sleep. Carolyn looks determined while Lester is awake and stares up at us. The rose petal drifts into view landing on his pillow and more rose petals fall onto the bed as he smiles up at them. Angela naked floats above us as a deluge of rose petals falls around her her hair fanning out around her head and glowing with a subtle burnished light. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. She looks down at us with a smile that is all things. Lester smiles back and laughs as rose petals cover his face. Jane stares at the floor and later gets out of the car still laughing and waves as Angela pulls away. We zoom toward Jane as she walks up the driveway. Suddenly she turns sensing our presence and we see the colonial house next door where the moving van was parked earlier with the front porch shrouded in darkness until a porch light abruptly reveals Ricky. As usual Ricky is dressed conservatively. Irritated Jane stares at him hard and he looks back at her curiously then raises his digicam and starts to videotape her. His point of view on video shows Jane angry and selfconscious turning and walking quickly toward her house flipping us off as she goes. Jane enters closes and locks the door quickly turns off the light that is been left on for her then peeks through a window and smiles. Jane turns back into the room her heart racing. Lester dressed for work goes through Jane's address book and grabs Jane's phone to dial standing with the receiver to his ear nervous but frozen and unable to speak. He hangs up and exits quickly as Jane emerges from the bathroom a towel wrapped around her torso drying her wet hair. She picks up the phone. Meanwhile Angela is sprawled across her bed on the phone. Jane then notices her address book open to the H page.

test_cases.description: Angela pulls her uniform open and a profusion of red rose petals spill forth. Fully clothed she is once again surrounded by the other girls. as the high school band plays its last note. She picks up the phone. Meanwhile Angela is sprawled across her bed on the phone. Jane then notices her address book open to the H page.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The giraffe pulls her uniform open, and a profusion of red rose petals spill forth. Fully clothed, the giraffe is once again surrounded by the other zebras as the high school band plays its last note, the Dancing Eaglettes strike their final pose, and the audience reacts. The dolphin claps along with the rest of the audience, while the penguin just sits there, unable to take his eyes off the giraffe. The game is long over when the kangaroo and the giraffe come out of the gym, and the penguin and the dolphin stand at the edge of the parking lot. The kangaroo crosses reluctantly toward her parents, followed by the giraffe, creating an awkward beat. As the kangaroo starts toward the parking lot, the penguin stays behind. The giraffe smiles, aware of the power she has over the penguin, who is mesmerized and feels grateful. Close on a solitary red rose petal as it falls slowly through the air. We're looking down on the penguin and the dolphin in bed, and even in sleep, the dolphin looks determined while the penguin is awake and stares up at us. The rose petal drifts into view, landing on his pillow, and more rose petals fall onto the bed as he smiles up at them. The giraffe, naked, floats above us as a deluge of rose petals falls around her, her hair fanning out around her head and glowing with a subtle, burnished light. She looks down at us with a smile that is all things. The penguin smiles back and laughs as rose petals cover his face. The kangaroo stares at the floor and later gets out of the car, still laughing, and waves as the giraffe pulls away. We zoom toward the kangaroo as she walks up the driveway. Suddenly, she turns, sensing our presence, and we see the colonial house next door where the moving van was parked earlier, with the front porch shrouded in darkness until a porch light abruptly reveals the fox. As usual, the fox is dressed conservatively. Irritated, the kangaroo stares at him hard, and he looks back at her curiously, then raises his digicam and starts to videotape her. His point of view, on video, shows the kangaroo, angry and self-conscious, turning and walking quickly toward her house, flipping us off as she goes. The kangaroo enters, closes and locks the door, quickly turns off the light that's been left on for her, then peeks through a window and smiles. The kangaroo turns back into the room, her heart racing. The penguin, dressed for work, goes through the kangaroo’s address book and grabs the kangaroo’s phone to dial, standing with the receiver to his ear, nervous but frozen and unable to speak. He hangs up and exits quickly as the kangaroo emerges from the bathroom, a towel wrapped around her torso, drying her wet hair. She picks up the phone. Meanwhile, the giraffe is sprawled across her bed, on the phone. The kangaroo then notices her address book open to the H page.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Angela pulls her sweater open, and a profusion of yellow daffodil petals spill forth. Fully dressed, she is once again surrounded by the other girls as the college orchestra plays its last note, the Dancing Warriors strike their final pose, and the guests react. Carolyn claps along with the rest of the guests, while Lester just sits there, unable to take his eyes off Angela. The concert is long over when Jane and Angela come out of the auditorium, and Lester and Carolyn stand at the edge of the garden. Jane crosses reluctantly toward her parents, followed by Angela, creating an awkward beat. As Jane starts toward the garden, Lester stays behind. Angela smiles, aware of the power she has over Lester, who is mesmerized and feels grateful. Close on a solitary yellow daffodil petal as it falls slowly through the air. We're looking down on Lester and Carolyn in a hammock, and even in sleep, Carolyn looks determined while Lester is awake and stares up at us. The daffodil petal drifts into view, landing on his cheek, and more daffodil petals fall onto the hammock as he smiles up at them. Angela, uncovered, floats above us as a cascade of daffodil petals falls around her, her hair fanning out around her head and glowing with a subtle, amber light. She looks down at us with a smile that is all things. Lester smiles back and laughs as daffodil petals cover his face. Jane stares at the carpet and later gets out of the truck, still laughing, and waves as Angela pulls away. We zoom toward Jane as she walks up the pathway. Suddenly, she turns, sensing our presence, and we see the Victorian house next door where the delivery van was parked earlier, with the front porch shrouded in shadows until a porch light abruptly reveals Ricky. As usual, Ricky is dressed casually. Irritated, Jane stares at him hard, and he looks back at her curiously, then raises his digital camera and starts to photograph her. His point of view, on camera, shows Jane, angry and self-conscious, turning and walking quickly toward her house, flipping us off as she goes. Jane enters, closes and locks the door, quickly turns off the lantern that's been left on for her, then peeks through a curtain and smiles. Jane turns back into the room, her heart racing. Lester, dressed for a meeting, goes through Jane's calendar and grabs Jane's tablet to type, standing with the device in his hand, nervous but frozen and unable to speak. He puts it down and exits quickly as Jane emerges from the closet, a towel wrapped around her torso, drying her wet hair. She picks up the tablet. Meanwhile, Angela is sprawled across her couch, on the tablet. Jane then notices her calendar open to the J page.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Angela closes her uniform gently, and a stream of blue butterfly wings flutter forth. Fully clothed, she is once again accompanied by the other girls as the high school string quartet completes its last chord, the Dancing Spartanettes hold their final step, and the audience whispers. Carolyn taps her feet along with the rest of the audience, while Lester simply slouches there, unable to take his gaze off Angela. The game is long over when Jane and Angela stroll out of the gym, and Lester and Carolyn wait at the edge of the parking lot. Jane walks casually toward her parents, followed by Angela, creating a serene moment. As Jane paces toward the parking lot, Lester pauses. Angela grins, aware of the influence she has over Lester, who is dazzled and feels amused. Close on a solitary blue butterfly wing as it flutters slowly through the air. We're looking down on Lester and Carolyn in bed, and even in sleep, Carolyn seems resolute while Lester is awake and peers up at us. The butterfly wing dances into view, settling on his pillow, and more butterfly wings drift onto the bed as he chuckles up at them. Angela, draped in a shimmering dress, glides above us as a cascade of butterfly wings swirls around her, her hair floating out around her head and shimmering with a subtle, golden glow. She gazes down at us with a grin that is everything. Lester chuckles back and giggles as butterfly wings cover his face. Jane stares at the floor and later hops out of the car, still giggling, and waves as Angela drives away. We glide toward Jane as she skips up the driveway. Suddenly, she spins, sensing our presence, and we see the colonial house next door where the moving van was stationed earlier, with the front porch cloaked in shadow until a porch light suddenly reveals Ricky. As usual, Ricky is dressed conservatively. Annoyed, Jane glances at him hard, and he gazes back at her inquisitively, then lifts his digicam and starts to photograph her. His point of view, on video, shows Jane, irritated and uncomfortable, turning and jogging quickly toward her house, waving us off as she goes. Jane enters, secures and bolts the door, quickly dims the light that's been left on for her, then glances through a window and grins. Jane pivots back into the room, her pulse racing. Lester, dressed for work, rifles through Jane's sketchbook and snatches Jane's phone to text, standing with the screen in his hand, agitated but motionless and unable to type. He sets it down and slips out quickly as Jane appears from the bathroom, a towel draped around her torso, drying her damp hair. She picks up the phone. Meanwhile, Angela is stretched across her bed, on the phone. Jane then notices her sketchbook open to the H page.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Marvin unzips his suitcase open, and a multitude of blue marbles tumble forth. Fully clothed, he is once again surrounded by the other penguins as the college orchestra plays its last chord, the Twirling Elephants strike their final stance, and the audience reacts. Nancy claps along with the rest of the crowd, while Arnold just sits there, unable to take his eyes off Marvin. The concert is long over when Derek and Marvin come out of the library, and Arnold and Nancy stand at the edge of the garden. Derek crosses reluctantly toward his grandparents, followed by Marvin, creating an awkward pause. As Derek starts toward the garden, Arnold stays behind. Marvin grins, aware of the influence he has over Arnold, who is mesmerized and feels thankful. Close on a single blue marble as it floats gently through the breeze. We're looking down on Arnold and Nancy in their tent, and even in slumber, Nancy looks resolute while Arnold is awake and stares up at us. The marble glides into view, resting on his slipper, and more marbles fall onto the mattress as he smiles up at them. Marvin, barefoot, hovers above us as a cascade of marbles falls around him, his fur fanning out around his ears and glowing with a soft, golden light. He looks down at us with a grin that encompasses everything. Arnold grins back and giggles as marbles blanket his face. Derek stares at the ceiling and later climbs out of the tent, still chuckling, and waves as Marvin drives away. We zoom toward Derek as he steps up the staircase. Suddenly, he turns, sensing our presence, and we see the cottage next door where the mail truck was parked earlier, with the balcony shrouded in darkness until a lantern suddenly reveals Toby. As usual, Toby is dressed traditionally. Annoyed, Derek glares at him hard, and he looks back at her inquisitively, then raises his microphone and starts to record her. His point of view, on video, shows Derek, frustrated and self-conscious, turning and walking briskly toward his treehouse, flipping us off as he goes. Derek enters, closes and locks the gate, quickly turns off the torch that's been left on for him, then peeks through a curtain and grins. Derek turns back into the garden, his heart pounding. Arnold, dressed for gardening, goes through Derek's journal and grabs Derek's camera to snap, standing with the lens to his eye, nervous but frozen and unable to click. He lowers it and leaves quickly as Derek emerges from the kitchen, a robe wrapped around his waist, drying his wet gloves. He picks up the camera. Meanwhile, Marvin is sprawled across his hammock, on the radio. Derek then notices his journal open to the J page.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Sophia rips her jacket open, and a stream of blue tulip petals flutter out. Fully dressed, she is once again encircled by the other boys as the college orchestra finishes its first symphony, the Twirling Panthers freeze in their initial stance, and the spectators cheer. Marcus cheers along with the rest of the spectators, while Derek just stands there, unable to look away from Sophia. The concert is long finished when Emma and Sophia leave the auditorium, and Derek and Marcus stay at the corner of the playground. Emma drifts hesitantly toward her friends, followed by Sophia, creating an uneasy silence. As Emma moves toward the playground, Derek lingers. Sophia beams, conscious of the influence she has over Derek, who is captivated and feels indebted. Close on a solitary blue tulip petal as it floats softly through the air. We're looking down on Derek and Marcus in the library, and even in sleep, Marcus looks resolute while Derek is awake and gazes up at us. The tulip petal glides into view, settling on his book, and more tulip petals cascade onto the table as he grins up at them. Sophia, clothed, levitates above us as a cascade of tulip petals descends around her, her hair spreading out around her head and shimmering with a delicate, golden glow. She gazes down at us with a grin that encompasses everything. Derek grins back and chuckles as tulip petals blanket his face. Emma glances at the ceiling and later hops out of the bus, still chuckling, and waves as Sophia departs. We zoom toward Emma as she strides up the walkway. Abruptly, she turns, sensing our gaze, and we observe the modern house next door where the delivery truck was stationed earlier, with the front porch cloaked in shadows until a porch light suddenly reveals Alex. As usual, Alex is dressed casually. Annoyed, Emma glares at him intensely, and he gazes back at her inquisitively, then lifts his camcorder and starts to film her. His point of view, on video, shows Emma, irritated and embarrassed, spinning and striding rapidly toward her home, gesturing at us as she leaves. Emma enters, closes and bolts the door, swiftly extinguishes the lamp that was left on for her, then peeks through a curtain and grins. Emma turns back into the hall, her pulse racing. Derek, dressed for a meeting, peruses Emma's calendar and takes Emma's smartphone to call, standing with the phone to his ear, anxious but paralyzed and speechless. He hangs up and departs hastily as Emma steps out of the kitchen, a robe wrapped around her body, brushing her dry hair. She picks up the smartphone. Meanwhile, Sophia is perched across her couch, on the phone. Emma then spots her calendar open to the J section.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Angela unzips her jacket, and a flurry of blue confetti flutters out. Still in her party attire, she is once again encircled by the other girls as the school orchestra finishes its final chord, the Dancing Spartanettes freeze in their concluding stance, and the audience responds. Carolyn bounces in time with the rest of the audience, while Lester just remains seated, unable to tear his gaze away from Angela. The concert is long over when Jane and Angela stroll out of the auditorium, and Lester and Carolyn linger at the edge of the garden. Jane approaches hesitantly toward her guardians, trailed by Angela, creating an uneasy pause. As Jane tiptoes toward the garden, Lester stays put. Angela grins, cognizant of the influence she wields over Lester, who is captivated and feels appreciative. Close on a solitary blue confetti piece as it drifts gently through the breeze. We're looking down on Lester and Carolyn in a hammock, and even in rest, Carolyn looks resolved while Lester is alert and stares up at us. The confetti drifts into view, settling on his chest, and more confetti pieces float onto the hammock as he grins up at them. Angela, clothed, glides above us as a storm of confetti swirls around her, her hair billowing around her shoulders and shimmering with a soft, burnished glow. She gazes down at us with a grin that embodies everything. Lester grins back and chuckles as confetti covers his face. Jane gazes at the ceiling and later steps out of the bus, still chuckling, and waves as Angela drives away. We zoom toward Jane as she strides up the walkway. Suddenly, she pivots, sensing our attention, and we see the Georgian house nearby where the food truck was stationed earlier, with the front yard cloaked in shadow until a porch light suddenly illuminates Ricky. As usual, Ricky is attired conservatively. Annoyed, Jane glares at him intensely, and he looks back at her with curiosity, then raises his camcorder and starts to record her. His perspective, on video, captures Jane, annoyed and self-conscious, turning and marching swiftly toward her home, gesturing rudely at us as she leaves. Jane enters, secures and bolts the door, quickly extinguishes the light that was left on for her, then peers through a window and grins. Jane pivots back into the room, her heart pounding. Lester, attired for errands, flips through Jane's diary and seizes Jane's cell to call, standing with the phone to his ear, anxious but immobilized and mute. He hangs up and leaves hastily as Jane steps out from the restroom, a robe draped around her shoulders, toweling her damp locks. She picks up the cell. Meanwhile, Angela is stretched across her sofa, on the cell. Jane then observes her diary open to the G page.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Miranda unzips her raincoat, and a cascade of blue feathers flutters out. Fully dressed, she is once again encircled by the other penguins as the city orchestra plays its last chord, the Twirling Butterflies strike their concluding stance, and the spectators respond. Eleanor cheers along with the rest of the crowd, while Harold just lingers there, unable to tear his gaze from Miranda. The concert is long finished when Lisa and Miranda stroll out of the theater, and Harold and Eleanor linger at the edge of the garden. Lisa trudges reluctantly toward her guardians, shadowed by Miranda, creating an uneasy pause. As Lisa approaches the garden, Harold stays behind. Miranda grins, aware of the influence she has over Harold, who is captivated and feels indebted. Close on a lone blue feather as it floats gently through the air. We're peering down on Harold and Eleanor in a boat, and even in slumber, Eleanor looks resolute while Harold is awake and glances up at us. The feather wafts into view, settling on his hat, and more feathers drift onto the boat as he chuckles up at them. Miranda, dressed in silk, hovers above us as a torrent of feathers cascades around her, her locks fanning out around her head and shimmering with a soft, golden light. She peers down at us with a grin that is everything. Harold grins back and giggles as feathers envelop his visage. Lisa gazes at the ceiling and later steps out of the van, still chuckling, and waves as Miranda drives away. We zoom toward Lisa as she saunters up the path. Suddenly, she spins around, sensing our presence, and we observe the Victorian mansion next door where the food truck was stationed earlier, with the veranda cloaked in shadow until a porch bulb suddenly illuminates Edwin. As usual, Edwin is garbed formally. Vexed, Lisa glowers at him fiercely, and he regards her inquisitively, then lifts his camcorder and begins to record her. His angle, on video, shows Lisa, irate and self-aware, rotating and rushing swiftly toward her abode, gesturing rudely at us as she proceeds. Lisa enters, seals and bolts the entrance, swiftly extinguishes the lamp that's been left glowing for her, then steals a glance through a window and grins. Lisa pivots back into the space, her pulse racing. Harold, clad for duty, rifles through Lisa's planner and snatches Lisa's mobile to punch in numbers, standing with the handset to his ear, jittery but motionless and mute. He disconnects and leaves hurriedly as Lisa emerges from the closet, a robe draped around her frame, drying her damp mane. She retrieves the mobile. Meanwhile, Miranda is splayed across her hammock, on the line. Lisa then observes her planner open to the G section.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Angela opens her uniform, releasing red rose petals as the high school band finishes playing. Surrounded by peers, Angela captivates Lester, who watches mesmerized. After the game, Jane and Angela join Lester and Carolyn in the parking lot, prompting an awkward moment. Angela smiles, aware of her effect on Lester. A red rose petal falls onto Lester's pillow as he lies in bed with Carolyn. Dreaming, he sees Angela floating amidst petals and smiles. Later, Jane spots Ricky videotaping her from a neighboring house, becoming self-conscious and irritated. She locks the door, peeks outside, and smiles, heart racing. Lester, nervous, tries calling someone from Jane's address book but hangs up silently. Angela, meanwhile, is on the phone at home. Jane notices her address book open to the H page.

book and grabs Jane's phone to dial standing with the receiver to his ear nervous but frozen and unable to speak As usual Ricky is dressed conservatively Jane then notices her address book open to the H page Jane stares at the floor and later gets out of the car still laughing and waves as Angela pulls away She picks up the phone Fully clothed she is once again surrounded by the other girls Angela naked floats above us as a deluge of rose petals falls around her her hair fanning out around her head and glowing with a subtle burnished light as the high school band plays its last note We zoom toward Jane as she walks up the driveway Meanwhile Angela is sprawled across her bed on the phone Carolyn claps along with the rest of the audience while Lester just sits there unable to take his eyes off Angela He hangs up and exits quickly as Jane emerges from the bathroom a towel wrapped around her torso drying her wet hair As Jane starts toward the parking lot Lester stays behind Angela smiles aware of the power she has over Lester who is mesmerized and feels grateful Jane turns back into the room her heart racing Angela pulls her uniform open and a profusion of red rose petals spill forth the Dancing Spartanettes strike their final pose and the audience reacts Irritated Jane stares at him hard and he looks back at her curiously then raises his digicam and starts to videotape her

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: Lester smiles back and laughs as rose petals cover his face Jane stares at the floor and later gets out of the car still laughing and waves as Angela pulls away We zoom toward Jane as she walks up the driveway Suddenly she turns sensing our presence and we see the colonial house next door where the moving van was parked earlier with the front porch shrouded in darkness until a porch light abruptly reveals Ricky As usual Ricky is dressed conservatively Irritated Jane stares at him hard and he looks back at her curiously then raises his digicam and starts to videotape her His point of view on video shows Jane angry and selfconscious turning and walking quickly toward her house flipping us off as she goes Jane enters closes and locks the door quickly turns off the light that is been left on for her then peeks through a window and smiles Jane turns back into the room her heart racing Lester dressed for work goes through Jane's address book and grabs Jane's phone to dial standing with the receiver to his ear nervous but frozen and unable to speak He hangs up and exits quickly as Jane emerges from the bathroom a towel wrapped around her torso drying her wet hair She picks up the phone Meanwhile Angela is sprawled across her bed on the phone Jane then notices her address book open to the H page Angela pulls her uniform open and a profusion of red rose petals spill forth Fully clothed she is once again surrounded by the other girls as the high school band plays its last note the Dancing Spartanettes strike their final pose and the audience reacts Carolyn claps along with the rest of the audience while Lester just sits there unable to take his eyes off Angela The game is long over when Jane and Angela come out of the gym and Lester and Carolyn stand at the edge of the parking lot Jane crosses reluctantly toward her parents followed by Angela creating an awkward beat As Jane starts toward the parking lot Lester stays behind Angela smiles aware of the power she has over Lester who is mesmerized and feels grateful Close on a solitary red rose petal as it falls slowly through the air We are looking down on Lester and Carolyn in bed and even in sleep Carolyn looks determined while Lester is awake and stares up at us The rose petal drifts into view landing on his pillow and more rose petals fall onto the bed as he smiles up at them Angela naked floats above us as a deluge of rose petals falls around her her hair fanning out around her head and glowing with a subtle burnished light She looks down at us with a smile that is all things
